case_vignette: A 45-year-old man with a past medical history of hypertension presents with concerns of a rash on his left thigh back that his wife noticed two days ago! The rash has been progressively enlargened! Patient denies any pain or any prior treatments! He thinks the surrounding skin is warm and may be infected, but he denies any drainage!  He reports that they went hiking eight days ago in Rhode Island!   Physical exam demonstrates a non-scaly large targetoid, pink-red patch on the left thigh
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on my left thigh back that has been getting bigger, and the skin around it feels warm.
How long have you had the rash and has it changed in appearance since it first appeared?
I noticed the rash two days ago and it has been progressively getting larger.
Have you experienced any other symptoms like fever, chills, or fatigue?
No, I haven't experienced any fever, chills, or fatigue.
Has the rash developed any blisters or is it just red and inflamed?
The rash is just a large pink-red patch without any blisters.
Do you have any known allergies or have you started using any new products recently?
No, I don't have any known allergies and haven't started using any new products recently.
Is there any pain or just warmth when you touch the rash area?
There is no pain, just warmth when I touch the rash area.
Do you have any existing medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
I have a history of high blood pressure.
Is there a history of skin conditions or similar symptoms in your family?
No, there's no history of skin conditions or similar symptoms in my family.
Final Diagnosis: Cellulitis
